Representation Utilities API (…utils)¶

PolyglotMol Representations Utilities Package.

Provides base classes, registry, IO, parallel execution, and custom exceptions for molecular featurization.

class polyglotmol.representations.utils.BaseFeaturizer(**kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: ABC

Abstract Base Class for all featurizers in PolyglotMol.

Subclasses must implement the _featurize method and potentially set class attributes like EXPECTED_INPUT_TYPE and OUTPUT_SHAPE.

EXPECTED_INPUT_TYPE: InputType | Tuple[InputType, ...] | List[InputType] = 21¶
OUTPUT_SHAPE: Tuple[int | None, ...] | None = None¶
__init__(**kwargs)[source]¶

Initializes the featurizer.

Parameters:

**kwargs – Featurizer-specific parameters. Stored in self.init_kwargs.

property name: str | None¶

Returns the registered configuration name associated with this instance if it was created via get_featurizer(name, …). Returns None if the instance was created directly via ClassName(…).

featurize(data_points: Any | Iterable[Any], input_type: InputType | None = None, n_workers: int = 1, **kwargs) → ndarray | None | List[ndarray | None][source]¶

Computes features for one or more data points, handling parallelism.

featurize_batch(data_points: Iterable[Any], **kwargs) → List[ndarray | None][source]¶

Featurize multiple data points.

This is an alias for featurize() with multiple inputs, provided for compatibility with subclasses that may override this method for batch processing optimization.

Parameters:

  • data_points – Iterable of input data

  • **kwargs – Additional parameters

Returns:

List of feature arrays (or None for failed items)

__call__(data_points: Any | Iterable[Any], input_type: InputType | None = None, n_workers: int = 1, **kwargs) → ndarray | None | List[ndarray | None][source]¶

Allows calling the featurizer instance like a function.

__repr__() → str[source]¶

Return a string representation of the featurizer.

get_output_info() → Tuple[Type, Tuple[int | None, ...]][source]¶

Returns information about the expected output type and shape of the featurizer.

Returns:

A tuple containing the expected

output type (e.g., np.ndarray) and the expected shape. Shape elements can be None if a dimension size is variable or unknown until runtime.

Return type:

Tuple[Type, Tuple[Optional[int], …]]

Example

(np.ndarray, (2048,)) for a fixed-size fingerprint. (np.ndarray, (None,)) for a variable-length descriptor vector.

class polyglotmol.representations.utils.BaseProteinFeaturizer(**kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: BaseFeaturizer

Abstract base class for protein sequence featurizers.

Extends BaseFeaturizer with protein-specific functionality. All protein featurizers should inherit from this class.

EXPECTED_INPUT_TYPE: InputType | Tuple[InputType, ...] | List[InputType] = 10¶
__init__(**kwargs)[source]¶

Initialize protein featurizer.

Parameters:

**kwargs – Featurizer-specific parameters

validate_sequence(sequence: str) → bool[source]¶

Validate if a sequence is a valid protein sequence.

Parameters:

sequence – Protein sequence string

Returns:

True if valid, False otherwise

Return type:

bool

preprocess_sequence(sequence: str) → str[source]¶

Preprocess protein sequence before featurization.

Default implementation converts to uppercase and handles special amino acids. Subclasses can override for model-specific preprocessing.

Parameters:

sequence – Input protein sequence

Returns:

Preprocessed sequence

Return type:

str

get_sequence_length(sequence: str) → int[source]¶

Get the length of a protein sequence.

Parameters:

sequence – Protein sequence

Returns:

Length of the sequence

Return type:

int

__repr__() → str[source]¶

Return a string representation of the protein featurizer.

class polyglotmol.representations.utils.InputType(value)[source]¶

Bases: Enum

Enumeration of possible molecular and protein input types.

This enum is used throughout PolyglotMol to identify data formats.

SMILES = 1¶
RDKIT_MOL = 2¶
MOLBLOCK = 3¶
SDF_FILE = 4¶
MOL_FILE = 5¶
MOL2_FILE = 6¶
PDB_FILE = 7¶
PYBEL_MOL = 8¶
MOLECULE = 9¶
SEQUENCE = 10¶
FASTA_STRING = 11¶
FASTA_FILE = 12¶
CIF_FILE = 13¶
PDB_ID = 14¶
ALPHAFOLD_ID = 15¶
UNIPROT_ID = 16¶
BIOPYTHON_STRUCTURE = 17¶
BIOPYTHON_SEQRECORD = 18¶
PROTEIN_DATA = 19¶
FILE_PATH = 20¶
UNKNOWN = 21¶
polyglotmol.representations.utils.mol_from_input(data: Any, input_type: InputType | None = None, **kwargs) → Any[source]¶

Parse molecular input and return RDKit Mol.

This is a compatibility wrapper that returns an RDKit Mol from various inputs.

Parameters:

  • data – Input data

  • input_type – Optional InputType hint

  • **kwargs – Additional options passed to Molecule.from_input()

Returns:

RDKit Mol object or None

polyglotmol.representations.utils.register_featurizer(name: str, cls: Type[BaseFeaturizer] | None = None, default_kwargs: Dict[str, Any] | None = None, **meta)[source]¶

Registers a general or small molecule featurizer class. Featurizers registered here are typically for small molecules. They must inherit from BaseFeaturizer.

polyglotmol.representations.utils.get_featurizer(name_or_cls: str | Type[BaseFeaturizer], **user_kwargs) → BaseFeaturizer[source]¶

Retrieves and instantiates a general/small molecule featurizer.

polyglotmol.representations.utils.list_available_featurizers(categorized: bool = False) → List[str] | Dict[str, List[str]][source]¶

Returns registered general/small molecule featurizer names.

Parameters:

categorized – If True, returns a dictionary categorized by featurizer type. If False, returns a sorted list of all names.

Returns:

Available featurizer names

Return type:

List[str] or Dict[str, List[str]]

polyglotmol.representations.utils.get_featurizer_info(name: str) → Dict[str, Any] | None[source]¶

Retrieves information about a registered general/small molecule featurizer.

Parameters:

name – Registered name of the featurizer

Returns:

  • class: The featurizer class

  • default_kwargs: Default initialization parameters

  • shape: Output shape of the featurizer (if available)

  • shape_type: Type of shape (“fixed”, “dynamic”, “parameterized”)

  • metadata: Additional metadata (description, source, category, etc.)

Return type:

Dictionary containing

polyglotmol.representations.utils.register_protein_featurizer(name: str, cls: Type[BaseFeaturizer] | None = None, default_kwargs: Dict[str, Any] | None = None, **meta)[source]¶

Registers a protein-specific featurizer class. Protein featurizers should inherit from BaseProteinFeaturizer (or BaseFeaturizer).

polyglotmol.representations.utils.get_protein_featurizer(name_or_cls: str | Type[BaseFeaturizer], **user_kwargs) → BaseFeaturizer[source]¶

Retrieves and instantiates a protein-specific featurizer.

polyglotmol.representations.utils.list_available_protein_featurizers(categorized: bool = False) → List[str] | Dict[str, List[str]][source]¶

Returns registered protein featurizer names.

Parameters:

categorized – If True, returns a dictionary categorized by featurizer type. If False, returns a sorted list of all names.

Returns:

Available protein featurizer names

Return type:

List[str] or Dict[str, List[str]]

polyglotmol.representations.utils.get_protein_featurizer_info(name: str) → Dict[str, Any] | None[source]¶

Retrieves information about a registered protein featurizer.

Parameters:

name – Registered name of the protein featurizer

Returns:

  • class: The featurizer class

  • default_kwargs: Default initialization parameters

  • shape: Output shape of the featurizer (if available)

  • shape_type: Type of shape (“fixed”, “dynamic”, “parameterized”)

  • per_residue_shape: Shape per residue for sequence featurizers (if applicable)

  • metadata: Additional metadata (description, source, category, etc.)

Return type:

Dictionary containing

polyglotmol.representations.utils.print_available_featurizers(categorized: bool = True, registry_type: str = 'small_molecule')[source]¶

Pretty print available featurizers in a tree structure.

Parameters:

  • categorized – Whether to show categorized view

  • registry_type – ‘small_molecule’ or ‘protein’

polyglotmol.representations.utils.select_featurizers_by_category(patterns: str | List[str], registry_type: str = 'small_molecule', exact_match: bool = False, remove_duplicates: bool = True) → List[str][source]¶

Select featurizers based on category patterns (CSS-like selectors).

Parameters:

  • patterns – Category path(s) to select. Can be: - Single string: “deepchem”, “fingerprints/rdkit”, “fingerprints/rdkit/morgan” - List of strings: [“deepchem”, “fingerprints/cdk”]

  • registry_type – ‘small_molecule’ or ‘protein’

  • exact_match – If True, require exact path match. If False, allow partial matching.

  • remove_duplicates – Whether to remove duplicate featurizer names from results.

Returns:

List of featurizer names matching the patterns

Examples

>>> # Get all DeepChem featurizers
>>> deepchem_featurizers = select_featurizers_by_category("deepchem")

>>> # Get all fingerprints
>>> fingerprint_featurizers = select_featurizers_by_category("fingerprints")

>>> # Get specific subcategory
>>> morgan_featurizers = select_featurizers_by_category("fingerprints/rdkit/morgan")

>>> # Get multiple categories
>>> mixed_featurizers = select_featurizers_by_category(["fingerprints/deepchem", "descriptor"])

>>> # Use with wildcards
>>> all_rdkit = select_featurizers_by_category("fingerprints/rdkit/*")
polyglotmol.representations.utils.create_featurizer_ensemble(*patterns: str, registry_type: str = 'small_molecule', max_featurizers: int | None = None, exclude: str | List[str] | None = None, prioritize: str | List[str] | None = None) → List[str][source]¶

Create an ensemble of featurizers by combining multiple category patterns.

Parameters:

  • *patterns – Variable number of category patterns to combine

  • registry_type – ‘small_molecule’ or ‘protein’

  • max_featurizers – Maximum number of featurizers to return (None for no limit)

  • exclude – Patterns or specific featurizer names to exclude

  • prioritize – Patterns to prioritize (these come first in the result)

Returns:

List of featurizer names for the ensemble

Examples

>>> # Create ensemble with different types
>>> ensemble = create_featurizer_ensemble(
...     "fingerprints/rdkit/morgan",
...     "fingerprints/deepchem",
...     "descriptor"
... )

>>> # Limit size and exclude certain types
>>> ensemble = create_featurizer_ensemble(
...     "fingerprints",
...     "descriptor",
...     max_featurizers=10,
...     exclude=["cdk", "datamol_avalon"]
... )

>>> # Prioritize certain categories
>>> ensemble = create_featurizer_ensemble(
...     "fingerprints",
...     "spatial",
...     prioritize="fingerprints/rdkit/morgan"
... )
polyglotmol.representations.utils.get_category_info(pattern: str = '', registry_type: str = 'small_molecule', show_counts: bool = True) → Dict[str, Any][source]¶

Get information about categories and their contents.

Parameters:

  • pattern – Category pattern to inspect (empty string for root)

  • registry_type – ‘small_molecule’ or ‘protein’

  • show_counts – Whether to include item counts

Returns:

Dictionary with category information

Examples

>>> # Get overview of all categories
>>> info = get_category_info()

>>> # Get info about fingerprints category
>>> fp_info = get_category_info("fingerprints")

>>> # Get info about DeepChem fingerprints
>>> dc_fp_info = get_category_info("fingerprints/deepchem")
polyglotmol.representations.utils.list_category_paths(registry_type: str = 'small_molecule', include_counts: bool = True) → List[str][source]¶

List all available category paths.

Parameters:

  • registry_type – ‘small_molecule’ or ‘protein’

  • include_counts – Whether to include item counts in the output

Returns:

List of category paths

Examples

>>> paths = list_category_paths()
>>> print(paths[:5])
['fingerprints (38)', 'fingerprints/cdk (15)', 'fingerprints/deepchem (6)', ...]
polyglotmol.representations.utils.run_parallel(items: Iterable[Any], n_workers: int = 1, use_threading: bool = False, progress: bool = False, progress_desc: str = 'Processing', *, func: Callable | None = None, featurizer_cls: Type[Type[Any]] | None = None, init_kwargs: Dict[str, Any] | None = None, call_kwargs: Dict[str, Any] | None = None, input_type_hint: Type[Any] | None = None) → List[Any][source]¶

Executes a function or featurizer task potentially in parallel over items. (Function body remains the same as previous version)

exception polyglotmol.representations.utils.PolyglotMolError[source]¶

Bases: Exception

Base class for exceptions in PolyglotMol.

exception polyglotmol.representations.utils.DependencyNotFoundError(message: str | None = None, *, dependency_name: str | None = None, install_message: str | None = None, name: str | None = None, path: str | None = None)[source]¶

Bases: PolyglotMolError, ImportError

Exception raised when an optional dependency is required but not found.

__init__(message: str | None = None, *, dependency_name: str | None = None, install_message: str | None = None, name: str | None = None, path: str | None = None)[source]¶
exception polyglotmol.representations.utils.FeaturizationError(message, original_exception=None)[source]¶

Bases: PolyglotMolError

Exception raised for errors during the featurization process itself.

__init__(message, original_exception=None)[source]¶
exception polyglotmol.representations.utils.InvalidInputError[source]¶

Bases: PolyglotMolError, ValueError

Exception raised for invalid input data, types, or values.

exception polyglotmol.representations.utils.RegistryError[source]¶

Bases: PolyglotMolError, KeyError

Exception raised for errors related to the featurizer registry (e.g., name not found).

exception polyglotmol.representations.utils.ParallelExecutionError[source]¶

Bases: PolyglotMolError

Exception raised for general errors during parallel execution setup or management.

exception polyglotmol.representations.utils.WorkerError(exception: Exception, item_index=None, item_info=None)[source]¶

Bases: Exception

Wraps an exception caught in a worker process/thread during parallel execution.

__init__(exception: Exception, item_index=None, item_info=None)[source]¶

Initializes the WorkerError.

Parameters:

  • exception – The original exception caught in the worker.

  • item_index – Optional index of the item being processed when the error occurred.

  • item_info – Optional additional info about the item (e.g., ID, first few chars of SMILES). Be cautious about including sensitive or very large data here.

polyglotmol.representations.utils.setup_logging(level=20, log_file: str | None = None)[source]¶

Configures logging for the PolyglotMol library.

Parameters:

  • level – The logging level (e.g., logging.INFO, logging.DEBUG).

  • log_file – Optional path to a file where logs should be written.
